issue.title: Cannot use `.app` as identifier suffix

labels.name: status: upstream
labels.description: This issue needs to be fixed in an upstream project

repository.name: plugins-workspace
repository.description: All of the official Tauri plugins in one place!

issue.body: I encountered a strange issue when I had `ai.splitfire.app` as my app's identifier on macOS target. The `fs` plugin doesn't create the directory data correctly. Instead, it creates `ai.splitfire` folder without the `.app`. However, if I renamed it to, say `ai.splitfire.SplitFire`, it works correctly. It's even behaves strangely when I name it `ai.splitfire.App`: I'm not sure if it's a bug or a feature. Any clue? Probably related: https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/6768

issue.title: [bug]

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

I'm trying to create a directory called "whatever" in my App Data on Mac OS, but when I do the directory is corrupted (or it thinks it is an app?) This is what the dir looks like (the name of my app is com.super-desktop)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ea9f309d-117d-484b-a271-0c70b08b83f8)

### Reproduction

```ts
const baseExists = await exists("whatever", { baseDir: BaseDirectory.Desktop })
if (!baseExists) {
  await mkdir("whatever", { baseDir: BaseDirectory.Desktop, recursive: true })
}
```

### Expected behavior

I'd expect the directory to be created

### Full `tauri info` output

```text
> tauri info


[âœ”] Environment
    - OS: Mac OS 14.4.0 arm64 (X64)
    âœ” Xcode Command Line Tools: installed

    âœ” Rust toolchain: stable-aarch64-apple-darwin (default)
    - node: 22.12.0
    - pnpm: 10.4.0
    - yarn: 1.22.22
    - npm: 10.9.0
    - bun: 1.1.34

[-] Packages
    - tauri ðŸ¦€: 2.2.5
    - tauri-build ðŸ¦€: 2.0.5
    - wry ðŸ¦€: 0.48.1
    - tao ðŸ¦€: 0.31.1
    - @tauri-apps/api îœ˜: 2.2.0 (outdated, latest: 2.3.0)
    - @tauri-apps/cli îœ˜: 2.2.7 (outdated, latest: 2.3.0)

[-] Plugins
    - tauri-plugin-shell ðŸ¦€: 2.2.0
    - @tauri-apps/plugin-shell îœ˜: 2.2.0
    - tauri-plugin-fs ðŸ¦€: 2.2.0
    - @tauri-apps/plugin-fs îœ˜: 2.2.0
    - tauri-plugin-opener ðŸ¦€: 2.2.5
    - @tauri-apps/plugin-opener îœ˜: 2.2.5 (outdated, latest: 2.2.6)

[-] App
    - build-type: bundle
    - CSP: unset
    - frontendDist: ../dist
    - devUrl: http://localhost:1420/
    - framework: React
    - bundler: Vite
```

### Stack trace

```text

```

### Additional context

I've got these set as my capabilities in tauri.conf.json

```
"capabilities": [
        {
          "identifier": "everything we need",
          "description": "I don't know what to put here",
          "windows": [
            "main"
          ],
          "permissions": [
            "core:path:default",
            "core:event:default",
            "core:window:default",
            "core:app:default",
            "core:resources:default",
            "core:menu:default",
            "core:tray:default",
            "fs:default",
            "fs:allow-appdata-write-recursive",
            "fs:create-app-specific-dirs",
            "fs:allow-mkdir"
          ]
        }
      ]
```

body: Apparently having an id that ends with ".ai" also [produces the same issue](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/6768#issuecomment-2132134666).
Is the issue still open to work ?

Hi, I'm currently trying to understand where to make the necessary changes in the codebase, but I'm having some trouble navigating the repository since I'm new to it. Could you please point me to the specific files or modules where the relevant code is located? That would really help me get started.

> Hi, I'm currently trying to understand where to make the necessary changes in the codebase, but I'm having some trouble navigating the repository since I'm new to it. Could you please point me to the specific files or modules where the relevant code is located? That would really help me get started.

I would say it's best to move this in [tauri discord](https://discord.gg/invite/tauri)

Could you please point me to the specific files or modules where the relevant code is located? That would really help me get started.
> 
> I would say it's best to move this in [tauri discord](https://discord.gg/invite/tauri)

Oh okay, thanks!
The channel is named tauri apps right ?
no real need to join the discord tbh. i just wasn't home yesterday. The current validation we have is here: https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/dev/crates/tauri-cli/src/build.rs#L132-L151

@FabianLars this is probably only an issue for macOS as I am not sure windows or Linux have undesired behavior with `.app` suffixed identifiers.

What's the ideal solution here?
We should probably print a warning (log::warn ?) on all platforms but only call exit(1) on macos (and prob log::error instead of warn)

issue.title: fix(cli): prevent .app identifier (fix #12674)

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(windows): fix race condition in event loop
    - docs: update example for `App::show`
    - feat: add `Window::set_fullscreen`

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. If there is a related issue, reference it in the PR text, e.g. closes #123.
3. If this change requires a new version, then add a change file in `.changes` directory with the appropriate bump, see https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/dev/.changes/README.md
4. Ensure that all your commits are signed https://docs.github.com/en/authentication/managing-commit-signature-verification/signing-commits
5. Ensure `cargo test` and `cargo clippy` passes.
6. Propose your changes as a draft PR if your work is still in progress.
-->
closes #12674

body: I've linked a pull request. Could you please check if it meets the requirements?

issue.body:
<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(windows): fix race condition in event loop
    - docs: update example for `App::show`
    - feat: add `Window::set_fullscreen`

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. If there is a related issue, reference it in the PR text, e.g. closes #123.
3. If this change requires a new version, then add a change file in `.changes` directory with the appropriate bump, see https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/dev/.changes/README.md
4. Ensure that all your commits are signed https://docs.github.com/en/authentication/managing-commit-signature-verification/signing-commits
5. Ensure `cargo test` and `cargo clippy` passes.
6. Propose your changes as a draft PR if your work is still in progress.
-->
closes #12674, in continuation to PR #13618

issue.title: fix: fix Linux and macOS build scripts
issue.body:
Issues found in pytauri/example-nicegui-app#3:

- Pass the `libpython` path correctly on Linux and macOS as `-L` arguments to `RUSTFLAGS`.

    - In b2404462275b9c9f1aacb2fd74ccf4d9de50a243 I don't know why (most likely I forgot) the `-L` argument was not set for `linux/build.sh`.
    - The `-L` argument in `macos/build.sh` is also incorrect; the quotes cause `-L "\"usr\lib\""`.

- Temporarily disable the `appimage` bundle target

    Currently unable to build `appimage`, see <https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/issues/9198>.

- Change the default `identifier` to `com.username.{{ project_name }}`

    Tauri no longer recommends identifiers ending with `.app`, see <https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/12674>.

    In <https://github.com/tauri-apps/create-tauri-app/pull/900> they changed it to `com.{whoami}.{project_name}`.
    I spent some time investigating and found that unless we enable the `--unsafe` feature to add a custom Jinja extension, we cannot obtain the username.
    So I decided to change it to `com.username.{{ project_name }}` for now.

issue.title: chore: change identifier to com.deskulpt

repository.name: Deskulpt
repository.description: Deskulpt (Desktop + Sculpt, pronounced /'deskÊŒlpt/), a cross-platform desktop customization tool.

issue.body:
`com.deskulpt.app` is not okay for macos, see: https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/12674

We would try `com.deskulpt`. If it is not unique enough, we should see a problem when releasing. Then we can consider other alternatives like `io.github.deskulpt` or `com.deskulpt.deskulpt` or others.
